intro: Cysticapnos africana, commonly known as the African spurge, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a resilient and drought-tolerant species.
